header.title: Bailey Davis on Sexism in the NFL | The Scarlet Letter Reports
header.subtitle: NA
header.postText: After posting a photo on her private Instagram, cheerleader Bailey Davis was fired from the New Orleans Saints due to failure to comply with Saintsations rules and regulations. She filed a complaint against the NFL for gender discrimination. Now, the suit has pushed Bailey into the national spotlight, and prompted harassment from online trolls all over the country. Watch more episodes of ‘The Scarlet Letter Reports' here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bMoPu... Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/Subscribe-to-BROADLY. Come find us: Broadly | https://broadly.vice.com. Facebook | https://www.facebook.com/BroadlyTV. Twitter | https://twitter.com/broadly. Tumblr | http://broadlytv.tumblr.com. Instagram | https://instagram.com/broadly. Pinterest | https://www.pinterest.com/broadlytv. Newsletter | http://bit.ly/1JKF1oA. More videos from the VICE network | https://www.fb.com/vicevideo

Aren't they professional sportspeople as well? What was the history that caused the NFL to segregate the two based on gender/role?

replies.commentText: That's simple! I'm more than happy to answer your question. The NFL has 32 different team with each team being worth billions of dollars. The owners of these teams dump millions into their players because their players bring in millions in return, they want to seperate cheerleaders from the players because often there are scandals (false rape accusations, assult, personal life problems etc..) between players and the cheerleaders which can cost the company millions upon millions of dollars so what they do is they setup policies that state if you want to work for me, you have to follow by my rules and if you don't wanna follow my rules then you are free to work somewhere else.

replies.commentText: Swnsasy _ That picture was sexy asf 🤤🤤🤤 but imma agree with the NFL on this one.
Buy My eBook! Can you explain why?

Swnsasy _ Of course. I believe companies have the right to do whatever they want and can do whatever they want in order to protect their company. This means providing policies and rules that employees are made aware of before agreeing to join the company. I see these policies as fair because society doesn't generally view cheerleaders as wh^res where as society DOES see a girl in lingere (yes it's lingere) with a grin on her face as a wh^re which in turn makes the company look bad. My suggestion to anyone who think this policy should change is that they should start THEIR OWN multi-billion dollar company and then they can let their employees do whatever they want, hell even go out naked in public if they wanted to, it's their company and they can do whatever they want with it. This is one of the beauties of the free market, if consumers don't like a company for their policies, they will boycott that company and they will lose money. However, most rational people see through this cheerleaders bs (she just wants money for free and doesn't want to follow rules) and won't do anything about it.

Buy My eBook! I do agree that some ignorance exists in people that see a picture in lingerie as a whore, but that is ignorants though and should not dictate... She wears less ON the field than she did in the photo so I guess I was more confused as to their statement on why she was let go... It's ok to go 3/4ths nude if I tell you too BUT it's absolutely horrible to go 1/4th nude on your personal page unless I say so..! Absolutely companies have rules but what I do OUTSIDE of my job is not my jobs business... I'll give you an example of what I mean.. You can actually look this up.. A woman teacher of 9th grade went on vacation in the Caribbean.. A friend took a picture of her laying in the sun with a swimsuit on and having a drink. ( Looked like a mixed fufu drink)... The friend uploaded it to social media... Come Monday she was FIRED because her ATTIRE and HAVING A DRINK, that is NOT acceptable.. So you think the school is right to do that?

Swnsasy _ There is a fundamental misunderstanding here. I'm aware of the fact that she has less on when shes on the field compared to her photo, my justification for this was the societal view on cheerleaders when compared to girls in lingere. So I will say this once again. It's okay for them to say "ok go 3/4ths nude if I tell you too BUT it's absolutely horrible to go 1/4th nude on your own personal page" because 1. It's their company 2. They made a policy that this girl was aware of before joining the corporation and 3. These societal views. I don't have an emperical data to back up what I am saying but it seems you are out of touch with how society views girls who look promiscious in lingere, for you to say that people who think like this are the minority would seem (to me atleast) very intellectually dishonest. The whole point of these massive multi-billion dollar corporations is to appeal to the majority to get as much revenue as possible, there will be exceptions to this rule but the NFL isn't one of them. Furthermore, you go on and ask my thoughts on the situation regarding the teacher. I'm not sure if you're actually curious on my thoughts or if you are trying to use some kind of shaming tactic on me. To me it seems that you are using a shaming tactic on me to misrepresent me and make your arguement look better in contrast. This is known as a logical fallacy. All I can say is I don't know, as I don't fully know about the situation. I can't make an opinion on something that I don't have a good grasp on in this context.

I know there's a lot of serious systemic problems in this video, but what institutions failed to protect the townspeople from having a City Hall with Comic Sans font? 9:49

The first time it hit me: A few years ago I made it the the final round of the New England Patriots Cheerleaders auditions. Not only are there 2 dance rounds, but there is a round where each girl must walk in front of the judges in a bikini while their bio is read. It seemed odd that we had to do that when we already were wearing skimpy outfits during our audition. But of course the NEPC have a calendar shoot each year, which include definitely suggestive photos of each girl in tiny bikinis. I am sure the organization makes thousands off of these calendars each year. I never understood why it was adequate to pay these women 15 dollars an hour to cheer for men that literally make millions and a team that generates an enormous amount of money each year. They sell this to us by saying that this is the big break... that every door will open for us after the exposure of being on this team. By the way, in this group there were Entrepreneurs, Ivy League graduates, teachers, and community leader. Far from the "typical cheerleader" stereotype. They all deserve so much better. The second time it hit me: Some time after the audition a professor at my University asked if I would be interested in organizing a dance team for the new semi pro state basketball league. When I met with the directors, they assured me that we would all be compensated. So I found some extremely talented women and brought them together. For months we practiced three times a week + game days and promo work. We sacrificed our jobs to be there. I thought it would be a good experience for me to coach so at first I was really passionate and excited. But when we still were not paid after months of work, I started asking questions. I found out the players were making $4,000+ per game. And that was the moment I realized that because of my gender, no matter how hard I worked, the odds are against me. I could go to the gym and practice as much as these men did for basketball. I could be more talented at dancing than these men are at basketball. But in the end, we don't matter. Soon I started having nightmares and eventually resigned. Hundreds of hours wasted for "exposure". My heart goes out to all these women that are used and thrown away. You matter.
she seems like the smartest, coolest person ever

commentThread.commentText: I've grown up in the south, and football is ingrained in the society here. It's crazy. I've never cared about it, but people here take it super seriously. I did cheerleading for a while (Competition cheerleading, not sports cheerleading) Cheerleading is really REALLY hard. I did it for extreme competition. We had to have makeup on, we had to have (and pay for!) our own uniforms and our practice shoes and our performance shoes as well as traveling expenses. We trained for hours. The NFL wants to sexualize these women for their own profit, and then slut shame them when they want create their own social media image. This isn't okay. I'm so fucking tired of women being treated like this and nothing happening.

You can work hard 24/7 and pull weeds from the ground all your life but you ain't gonna get paid as much as someone like Steve Jobs who created the future and something that we use everyday and have made a necessity. Furthermore the NFL isn't slut shaming these girls, they made a policy that protects themselves from losing millions. These girls KNEW of the policy yet they STILL signed up and STILL broke the rules and STILL had the audacity to complain about it. Society doesn't view cheerleaders as sluts, however that doesn't mean they aren't sexualized. However society does view girls in lingere (yes it's lingere) with the face shes making as something negative and the NFL simply doesn't want that image. So I tell you what, sweetheart, how about you make YOUR OWN multi billion dollar company and then you can let your employees do whatever they want (like walk around naked, poop on the streets, yell at kids, whatever i dont freaking know) m'kay?

replies.commentText: Oluchi Osueke not easily, especially w/ the added cost of all of the mandatory primping.💅🏻 Many NFL cheerleaders work one or more other jobs, if not during the season, which can be tough scheduling-wise, then definitely during the off season. For many it's something related such a teaching, coaching or choreographing dance or cheer, at least in part, & I've heard doing temp work is also pretty common. I'm not a big fan of football or cheerleading for various reasons, & am even less fond of the NFL in particular, but given the massive amount they bring in as an organization & considering how much even the lowest tier benchwarmers make it is atrocious - & imo downright inexcusable - that their cheerleaders - elite athletes in their own right - don't even make a living wage during the season. And that doesn't even begin to touch on the plethora of nonsensical inequities & other issues that are long overdue for some serious revision.

commentThread.commentText: then dont work for a private team. get a government job
This is an old story

The industry here in Australia is just as bad if not worse. I was a cheerleader for a major national football team. I only did it for my love of dance. Was not paid for all of the expected upkeep and extensive training. Received about $60 per game. Lasted a year before being fed up with it and quit. Unfortunately, the 'good old boys' club and ridiculous attitude have yet to die out.
Sad asf and sexist
Saints..more like the Aints
TBH NFL cheerleaders need to be eliminated from the game anyway. Theyre so damn pointless! srsly its 2019
Thank you for doing much-needed work for female emancipation. Let's hope 2019 is a better year for women.

I used to cheer for CJFL (Canadian junior football league - they filtered into the CFL). We did not get any compensation. We practiced 3 times a week, we bought our own outfits, we paid our own way. This sucks that they have these awful standards... in our league it was about doing stunts. At least, most of the time.. we were all a group, except the older members who were in a special group. We were also told not to fraternize with players, but pretty much all of the head cheerleaders were at their parties. It felt awful being a 14 year old watching a 17 year old shame me for being young.. and I bet some of my teammates have gone down bad paths because of it.

commentThread.commentText: So basically the NFL sexualized the cheerleaders and require they be sexy and show plenty of skin so that the NFL can capitalize on men's attention to them, but if the women themselves post anything vaguely sexualized it's suddenly a disgrace and poor moral character to attract male attention. replies.commentText: Basically. This is the epitome of hypocricy. There are so many unfair and abusive situations in this story about how these organization works, they're evident to the naked eye, not even subtle. It's so shameful.
the rule said no lingerie pics
meneedmoney it's not lingerie, it's a body suit, and the rule is still discriminatory.  It's like when schools say no braids or dreads, it's discriminatory against people of color.

@meneedmoney It doesn't matter what is the item prohibited in the rule, it doesn't matter what is the name of the item she was wearing on the picture... The point is: no company, no employer, no job has any right to control their employees private lives. They can make rules about how she has to dress at work, during work hours, as long as they're not discriminatory... But they have no fucking right to tell her how can she dress or not outside of working hours nor about what she can publish in her social media. It's her life! Her privacy! She is not their property! Those women are human beings, not plastic dolls, not trophies, not things! Plus, their clothing rules are hypocritical and ridiculous considering how they demand them to dress, stay skinny, stay muscular and show skin on the field! That company is fucking manipulating their employees, controlling their private lives, paying them way under the reasonable pay for the amount of hours they work! And they have the audacity to refuse to even have a conversation or reach an agreement or even make a statement about the issue! I have no words to describe how shameless they are. This is against human rights. Period.
@Loba Étoile agreed

It is all about the money and control. men can make the money off of sexy women, women can't make money off their own bodies. God forbid women take their power back and men can no longer  profit off of sexy women. sighs...
@meneedmoney She wears even less when she's actually cheering - hugely fucking hypocritical
then they should go work for a government job that doesnt allow stuff like that. because its a private team and business that could fire them all if they wanted to
H. Marsh hypocritical/double standards and exploitation. Yeah really messed up
True shit. Well put.

@meneedmoney It wasn't lingerie, it was a dance body suit. I can literally walk next door to the local ballet studio which also sells dance wear and pick up something extremely similar in less than 5 minutes. 


Even if it was in the rules, and it was "lingerie", their "rules" are incredibly sexist and hypocritical. Just bc it's in a contract, doesn't mean it's ok. I love how so many people will be quick to call unethical contracts against athletes, music artists and even professional gamers "null and void" because they're "predatory", and "exploitative", but the second these contracts are leveled against women c content that 110% worse, it's suddenly "ok", and "they should have known better, and not signed if they weren't ok c it".

The reason the NFL treats cheerleaders so poorly is because cheerleading is seen as a cost. Cheerleaders need to propose a way to make cheerleading profitable for the NFL. Or change cheerleading to something else altogether that entertains a primarily male audience. Maybe hire female actors and cheerleaders to do half time shows?

​@Boy Wonder A cost? They charge them to audition. They charge people to pay for them to show up at events. They charge for photos with them. They charge fees to those wh hire them if they have to travel too far. They make money off of these ladies. Not adveritsement dollars or Super Bowl ticket price dollars but they definitely get more out of them than the amount that they pay them. 
Why have the cheerleaders do the halftime show when you can have celeb musicians do it for little to no money. They cover production costs and some other expense having to do with performing but do not pay them a fee.
They should just get rid of cheerleaders. They are only there to make men hard anyways.

commentThread.commentText: It's hard to break the double standard of an " old school," male run organization. You need to get them to drop in on 2019 where women no longer have to stand for this type of abuse. I'm behind you all the way. Cheerleaders are sex symbols and without them I doubt that the players would be making as much. The cheer leaders bring in the crowd too. It's a big scam on the wages. You gals are not being appreciated in your roll as money generators. You train even harder then the players do for next to no money. Time to start a cheer leaders union IMHO. The money men know that if they fire all cheer leaders they are going to loose out so they try to keep you under their thumb while filling their pockets. This is not a fair world so if you want the respect due you, you have to fight for it. You gals may look like Barbie dolls to be played with but your not and you should stand up for your rights to your fair share of the profits. Remember Cheer leaders can't be replaced with funky robots or costumed clowns. The League knows that, "sex sells," it's your ace to work with. Lets just say that all the cheer leaders posted images in sexy lingerie. (Not recommended for the possibility of attracting stalkers but you don't have to be a cheer leader for that anyways.) All the fans on Instagram are going to flock to the stadium to see you in real life for a chance to meet you. If the money men had half a brain they would encourage this practice. Sure you're going to feel safer if you take self defense training. With the raise at the box office, the team will be able to afford it.

replies.commentText: Football started out as nonprofitable sport and has been like that for long time in history. Female football and male football are both businesses nowadays. The female one is about 40 times less profitable. If you want to get paid equal you have to produce equal. People, including women, generally want to see peek performance, hence they watch male sports more than female sports. Cheerleaders do not train as hard as an athlete. Cheerleaders are pretty much irrelevant to overall profit, hence they are paid poorly. If they brought double the people, they would have similar salaries to players. In short, logic > feelings and there are objective reasons for the way things are, not sexism or unfairness as victims want to believe for their lack of understanding and success.

@sweet bunny "Cheerleaders do not train as hard as an athlete." Sorry I'm going to have to correct you on this. As a dancer that studied the art for over 30 years, it's more training then most athletic endeavors involve. These gals are athletes in their own right. Practice practice practice. We use to say it was the hardest passion to perfect and involved the most energy. I was never a cheer leader BTW, (Wrong body type for the era and too many other options to work with.) There was one show that ran for a few years that showed the behind the scene work involved. Sorry, senior moment, I can't recall it's name. It all revolved around the the players and the cheer leaders. It showed the amount of effort involved in the art of cheer leading. If your not good enough to be one of the very few who have what it takes to join the ballet companies, don't want to be a clown or strut your stuff in the strip joints, then Cheer leading is a well respected choice. At the wages they receive, it's criminal. Years of dance classes for what? Sure they are all hot gals who can land a rich husband, but it's a new century and women need to be able to control their own lives if they wish to without being trophies. We are not chattel.

@Diane Neill Learn to compete in the free market. As a woman you have the advantage because women make up 85% of the consumerist purchases, despite the "wage gap". It's not the men that makes the rules, it's the market that decides. Otherwise 80% of the homeless would not be men. Plenty of women in sports who make shit tons of money, the good ones. Being a cheerleader is voluntary. Professional victimhood and scamming for example also pay well e.g. Anita Sarkeesian. Sink or swim, you are not chattel, you are an independent and responsible adult who makes choices and suffers consequences, like all adults should.

@sweet bunny No, fuck this capitalist apology. I refuse to accept my own dehumanisation and exploitation in the name of survival. 

And to deny that there are structural and historical inequalities that continue to contribute to that exact inequality is so intellectually dishonest. Despite what you say, we do not live in a meritocricy.

@sweet bunny Who is asking for a salary equal to the football players? They're asking for enough to cover their expenses + a small salary. They're making the same or less than people slinging dogs even though they're somewhat the face of the NFL.

Diane Neill Sex sells alright... just not in the NFL. People don't pay thousands of dollars to go see cheerleaders dance. They pay thousands of dollars to watch 6 foot tall 200 pound me demolish each other. It doesn't matter how much work one puts in. If you don't produce value, you're worthless. If people got paid depending on how much work they did then a Mexican fellow down the street I know who works on a farm would be a multi millionaire.

Diane Neill It's just insane. You don't see guys complaining about this crap in the porn or modeling industry. It's because we are aware that there is no market for males which is why the VAST majority of male adult actors and modes get paid little and sometimes even end in debt. It was their choice thoufh the same way as it's these cheerleaders fault. This is exactly why nothing will change and there is nothing you can do about because any rational person knows this. And by seeing your point of view on issues like these it seems like you are going to hate alot of things in life because we have rational laws everywhere that irrational people like you seem to hate. My advice to you is to inform yourself so you don't live a life of hate. Because things like these will NEVER change. :)

@Buy My eBook! that's a disgusting view on human beings. Wow! That's so vile. Humans aren't a commodity in the machinery of produce. You only value "productive" (very narrowly defined too) people? How incredibly cold and psychopathic.

smaakaker You're cappin and mad shamin right now... well at least TRYING TO. I don't value productivity. I value what makes value. And actually I don't believe humans are a piece of machinery nor animals. This is why I'm an ethical vegan and a self made entrepeneur because I realised that I wasn't meant for the 9-5 rat race in which these machines don't care about peoples emotion just about what they can do for the company. This is also why I also encourage others to be entrepeneurs.. to make their own dream a reality :)
smaakaker I wanna make a point. What kinda phone you got?

@Buy My eBook! I merely responded to what you said. YOU used the word "useless". Not me. And that's extremely dehuamnizing. 

If you are bragging about being a capitalist to make yourself seem better, I am sorry, but that won't fly with me. Whatever makes you sleep, I guess...
@GimmeYourJuice Are you going to try and use the old and trite argument that since I participate in a capitalist system, I can't xomplain about it? Get the fuck outta here, smooth brains.

smaakaker I know right away that you intentionally misconstrude arguements to fit your subjective point of view. In context, calling someone worthless didn't mean they had no moral value, you just claimed that I claimed that and completely disregarded the context. So if I have to be a school teacher for you let me define worthless in the context of my premise: produce no or minimal value which us humans want. And his point is actually valid. How can you participate in a system you don't like? It's like me saying I hate the unethical treatment of animals while still supporting the animal products industry by eating meat. It makes no sense. You could argue that you NEED phones to spread your anti-capitalist agenda but that would still be a double standard which is immoral according to our objective moral values (law) which states that double standards, and hypocracy is wrong.
smaakaker You may also make the analogy. You complain about life yet you participate in it. That is what is called a fallacy and a false comparison.
smaakaker Talk about the biggest strawman fallacy ever.
GimmeYourJuice Yes indeed very much. I never said or implied people have no moral value simply becasus they don't produce value in the market place.
@Buy My eBook! Eh, yeah.... that was my whole point. Selfawarewolves, much?
smaakaker Your arguement is flawed, and you tried to refute a point I didn't make.

@Buy My eBook! Who is asking for pay equality? No one said they should earn what players are earning. Asking for fair compensation is not the dame as asking for pay equality. Guys in porn tend to have longer careers and only a few women get top tier so that they really outpace the guys in their careers. I wonder if part of the reason that men in porn don't complain is because they know what they value in porn. Do they see their worth simultaneously through the eyes of the performer and consumer? Do they know that they may get slightly less until they become a name and that they'll probably be in the game much longer than their lady counterpart?

T C You're strawmanning aswell. Quote to me a statement of mine that said or implied that I was refuting equal pay? There was no such thing. I'm stating that these cheerleaders don't get "fair compensation" because they only work 10 days a season and they don't bring in enough revenue therefore they get paid what they're worth. What you want is that you want them to get paid money that they don't deserve. Not to mention that you cherry picked my example of male adult actors and models to make it seem like you won the arguement. There is no emperical evidence which shows the breakdown of porn through measurements like gender but I can say anecdotally that the porn industry is dominated by women. What I do know is that even in non top teir porn women get paid while men don't, that isn't to say SOME men will make more than women but it seems like, to you, that the exception should overturn the genral rule. Just because one man, such as Johnny Sins, Manuel Ferrera etc.., gets paid millions DOES NOT change the fact that the VAST majority of men don't get paid as much as women in the adult entertainment industry.

​@Buy My eBook! Where did I say that you were refuting equal pay? My comment was based on this "You don't see guys complaining about this crap in the porn or modeling industry" I assumed that "this crap" was pay equality because that is what most of theis thread has been about. If you intended it to mean something else, then that is cool but it is easy enough to understand why I thought that you were piggybacking on the train of thought discussed earlier by someone with a similar stance as yours. You say they don't deserve it BUT they do far more than work during the games. hell, I just saw my city's cheerleaders performing at a concert for an old school jam. They used their official uniforms and repped the team so it was all official. They work more than 10 days a year and are pretty ambassadors for the team. No one is sayign they should be able to work it as a full time job and live in luxury just that $10 an hour and having to pay out of pocket for a lot of things required of them seems nutty given the profit margins of this particular company Cherrypicked? You gave the example so I talked about what you talked about. How is that cherry picking? Men don't get paid in porn? They're doing it for free? What exception? The exception is people who make it to top tier period. Other than that it all depends on the scenes and the person. Overall women end up paid more per film and men end up paid more during their career due to longevitiy or at least that is what some surveys, and articles have said. The only common thing seems to be that directors get the most and that's definitely still a male dominated field. It's all over the place. Back to cheerleaders, they seem to do a lot on the field and off but are getting paid the same as someone in a field that requires little to no training. That seems a bit off to me. I don't get why that is such a controversial statement. It's like dudes goign on an on about whether someone is worth 10 mil or 5 mil when they're traded. You may not see their value because you're just watching the game but someone in the NFL sees it or they wouldn't bother using them as ambassadors at all.
@Buy My eBook! You're right. They just pay a couple hundred an hour per cheerleader.

T C "Where did I say that you were refuting equal pay?" What you said "Who is asking for pay equality?" directly implies that I was refuting pay equality. However, I'll just take what you said as an honest mistake, no harm done. "You say they don't deserve it BUT they do farm more than work during games. hell, I just saw my city's cheerleaders performing at a concert for an old school jam. They used their official uniforms and repped the team so it was all offical. They work more than 10 days a year and are pretty ambassadors for the team." This is an anecdote with no emperical data to back it up. Can you say with certainty that other organizations do this? "No one is sayign they should be able to work it as a full time job.." Then shut the hell up because I wasn't refuting that either. If you actually read my comment instead of skimming through it you would know that I specificaly said that they get paid on how well they do their job and how much value they make in the marketplace. They very well COULD be paid lots of money... but only if they brought in enough revenue to make them worthy of earning that type of money. Furthermore, you did cherrypick my examples because you had nothing to say about male modeling. You realised that you couldn't debate it, therefore you avoided it and focused all then attention on male adult actors to make it seem like you won the arguement. The truth is men in the "non top tier" porn get paid very little if not any? Where do you think Manuel Ferrera and Johnny Sins started out? Working for FREE. There is a fundemental misunderstanding that I can spot here though. I am not talking about the adult acting industry as a whole (CEO's, crew members, casting members, camera men etc...) I am talking about the front line of the industry, the pornstars. If we take a look at the industry as a WHOLE, yes males do get paid more because.. well... they wre the CEO's and the ones in high positions, women can make their own companies if they wanted to.. but they don't. If we were to focus the attention onto the frontline of the industry, we see a much different story. Women DO get paid more then men and there ARE exceptions to this rule because there are male pornstars who get paid more than some women. It's not a hard concept to understand. In general though, males make less. Link to me these surveys and articles... as if there any reliable sources. I'd prefer buisness reports from the actual companies but whatever.

@Buy My eBook! and before you say something silly like I can't take it or whatever. I've learned that the fun in this is learning more about all sides of an argument but not at the expense of letting folks think it's ok to be dumb and blatantly disrespectful. I wouldn't let someone tell me to shut the fuck up in person and I'm not going to do it on the internet. Where is the fun in that?

T C You couldn't refute a single point I made and just got mad because I hurt your feelings and told you to shut the hell up. So guess what? SHUT THE HELL UP. @Benedict Cumbersnatched  Still doesn't change the fact that is what they are trying to do. That's why the rules are in place. replies.commentText:
And it's even worse than just making $10/hour. In reality they make much less than that. Only the hours where they're officially practicing/performing are clocked, which is only a fraction of the effort they put in for the job. None of the outside practice, the dance classes, the public appearances, the physical conditioning, etc etc is included. They don't get extra pay to account for the fact that they have to practice ALL YEAR for a relatively short season, so the pay is only equivalent to a part time temp job rather than a yearly salary.

Part of why sports players/entertainers are paid so much is that they're getting compensated for essentially a lifetime of putting every ounce of energy and cash into their profession. A lot of these women are professional dancers or were college cheerleaders (college cheerleading is treated like the real sport it is). They're legitimate athletes, but they're treated like Hooters waitresses (or worse, at least Hooters waitresses make decent money) because of the culture of the NFL.

replies.commentText: Very good video showing misinformation and a victim's perspective. Football started out as nonprofitable sport and has been like that for long time in history. Female football and male football are both businesses nowadays. The female one is about 40 times less profitable. If you want to get paid equal you have to produce equal. People, including women, generally want to see peek performance, hence they watch male sports more than female sports. Cheerleaders do not train as hard as an athlete. Cheerleaders are pretty much irrelevant to overall profit, hence they are paid poorly. If they brought double the people, they would have similar salaries to players. In short, logic > feelings and there are objective reasons for the way things are, not sexism or unfairness as victims want to believe for their lack of understanding and success.
